name: Hotel Providence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hotel Providence online in June for $99 a night, to stay for the Newport Folk Festival. The staff was great, very attentive, and very helpful. Parking in the neighborhood is terrible, so we went for the $25 a day parking. The helped us find late night dinner that was perfect.
reviews.title: Lovely little boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neighborhood is iffy. I wouldn't feel comfortable walking around alone as a woman, but with two of us we were fine. It was clean enough, with some wear on the sofa in the room. It was also kinda noisy. Despite being on the top floor, we could hear the concert get out down the street at 2 a.m.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights for the Rhode Island Film Fest and had a wonderful time. The hotel is very centrally located and we didn't take our car out once the whole week. The staff is extremely friendly and the room was great too. Being our first time in Providence, it took us a few days to find any place to eat, as a lot of the places in the downtown core didn't seem terribly appealing, but definitely take a walk up to Federal Hill for some good eats and shopping, about 15 minute walk from the hotel. Julian's on Broadway is also a fantastic little spot with a great menu and cool atmosphere and service. Brown Univ. is also an easy walk. A few of the reviewers have commented on the location of the hotel being undesirable, but it's pretty much your standard downtown location. There are some sketchy characters, but that comes with the territory and my husband and I walked home from all over the city after midnight every night and never felt unsafe. There is also wireless in the room which is a huge bonus and free local calls.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: My only real complaint was the valet parking costs $25/day, which I knew going into it but is still a bit much considering we didn't access our car once over the whole trip.
reviews.title: Best Hotel and Staff I have ever stayed with!

reviews.text: My family was recently in Providence to take our daughter to tour Brown University. We stayed for two nights at the Hotel Providence and were extremely pleased. The staff was attentive and helpful. The room was lovely and well appointed. The restaurant was excellent with a beautiful outdoor eating area and showed a fantastic city view. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Providence again.
reviews.title: Thank you Hotel Providence

reviews.text: Very pretty hotel with a nice staff. Well located in the heart of downtown. Close to shops and public transportation. Room was very comfortable and quiet. On the first night a party let out a 1:00 am and there was some noice in the streets for a few minutes - other than that - it was a perfect stay. Loved the Keurig coffee maker in the room!
reviews.title: Beautiful and charming little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a short, one-night stop on a return trip from Martha's Vineyard. Definitely a good value. Room was comfortable and a nice size. Only real concern was the banging pipes (as mentioned in a previous review) coming from the bathroom. We shut the door to the bathroom and problem solved.
reviews.title: good all-around experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never been in Providence before, we asked the front desk if anything was going on in town that night (it was about 8PM) - she told us the hotel bar was open until 11. I'm sure they're obligated to say so, but we were a bit taken aback that this was the only suggestion. Luckily, we found a great restaurant/bar to spend the evening.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, convenient location

reviews.text: Great value, clean, beautiful accomodations, good location.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend this hotel for your next trip to Providence. Very comfortable beds, good TV selection, and we found the city very walk-able from this location.
reviews.title: Pre Christmas Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was ok, but not as nice as I had expected it to be. There were a few problems that seemed unnecessary. I will also say that this hotel was our second choice, but I was excited to stay here since we try and find offbeat, unusual hotels. At first everything was great, even with all the traffic from Waterfire (why we were there too), we had no problem getting to the hotel and valet took the car, the receptionist was nice, our room was on the top floor and had great views. It also struck us as being very clean. The room was not huge, but was fine, the best was excellent, very soft and comfy. The bathroom was huge and also very clean and beautiful.
reviews.title: Ok but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I realized I had forgotten to ask for a late check out I called the front desk, and was told no(!) by a man. I was told the hotel was booked full so it wasn't an option. I was not impressed by this. When we returned in the late evening the same girl was at reception and I asked again about a late check out and this time was told we could have the room until 1pm.
reviews.title: High priced for what it offers

reviews.text: During the night there was noise that sounded like pipes banging in the walls. It was irritating, but ultimately it didn't keep us from sleeping. My husband did say that it sounded like people outside were having a party till about 4am, but since he was up anyway this wasn't an issue. However the church next door did chime every half hour or hour and since our morning there was Sunday they went all morning too.
reviews.title: Quite noisy room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About 10:30 we tried to order breakfast to the room but had enormous trouble doing so. There was no room service menu in our room so I dialed the room service ext. only to get a voicemail. I called the front desk who assured me they did do breakfast and I should call roomservice. I told him I had gotten no answer, but front desk said they would have someone call us. They did right away, but were reluctant to bring us a menu, the girl wanted to go over the choices over the phone with me , which I thought was odd. I asked again for a menu to be sent up. It finally was, but I felt like we had to go to alot of work for something that shouldn't have been that hard.
reviews.title: Neat Place, Great Location

likes.liked: — Downtown Location, Local Business, Cool Building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we left the valet brought our car and then left with our keys! We had to go and find someone to find him to get our keys back. That was a little strange too.
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in Providence! Wonderful!

reviews.text: The Hotel providence has become a favorite of my family and friends! This is a charming European style hotel in the center of downtown Providence. It has its own parking and a great restaurant. They have large rooms and bathrooms and each seems to be a little different in decor. The Lobby and halls host beautiful museum quality artworks and antique furniture. The staff makes you feel as though,you are at home and call you by your name. I look forward to each stay and would always reommend this wonderful hotel! Mr.Dennis
reviews.title: A Fantastic Upscale Boutique Hotel filled with antigues and charm!

reviews.text: I gave my parents an overnight getaway for Christmas at The Hotel Providence and they raved about the rooms & the staff. When I brought them to the hotel The doorman & valet were very friendly and helped us in and the woman at the front desk was very friendly and checked my parents in quickly. I helped them to the room and the room that they had was bigger than I expected. They raved about how comfortable the beds were and mentioned that they had a great night's rest. They didn't get to eat at the restaurant, but mentioned that they wanted to come back and try it out. I want to thank the staff of the hotel for making my parent's stay a really nice one that they'll never forget.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel !!

reviews.text: We came into Providence looking to have a good time and meet some people, and stumbled across the Hotel Providence. We had noticed the music coming from the resaurant there so we decided to start our night there. The staff was so great and fun we ended up having a few too many and stayed the night!
reviews.title: Great Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After doing some research I came across this upscale, "boutique style", hotel in the up and coming city of Providence, RI. My wife and I had a romantic getaway weekend planned in the capitol city of The Ocean State. We would arrive on Saturday afternoon and check into our hotel. Then we would take a stroll down the narrow New England streets to the Providence Performing Arts Center Theatre to take in a show,(Anthony Bourdain was in town), afterwards we could then head back to the hotel restaurant to top off the night with a great meal for two and a nice bottle of wine. Gleefully I booked everything online a few weeks ahead and looked forward to our great little getaway.
reviews.title: Turned away at the door

reviews.text: Finally the date arrived and we took to the road. Upon our arrival the Valet greeted with a smile and offered to help us with our bags. We went into the lavishly appointed lobby and were impressed with the surroundings we now found ourselves in. After waiting a few moments in line to check in, we approached the front desk. We gave our names to the receptionist and suddenly everything changed. From out of nowhere the "Shift Manager" appeared and began to explain to me that the hotel had been over booked for the evening and that our room had been given away to someone else. He apologized for any inconvenience and state he had made other arraignments for us somewhere else. It seems the there was a Hampton Inn somewhere in the city,(guess the Motel 6 was full) and he got us a room there. The guests behind us in line chuckled. It was the most embarrassing thing I have been through in years. We were shocked at the spectacle he made to usher us out the door. He ran ahead of us to make sure the valet didn't park our car in their lot. He wanted us out ASAP, I'm sure not to interrupt any of his real guests. My wife and I have stayed in hotels all over, both in the US and outside the US. We've stayed in small B&B's in Vermont to Ritz Carlton's in Boston,(yes it had two) from The ST. Georges' Club in Bermuda to the Club Orient in St. Martin, and I have never had something like this happen to me before.
reviews.title: Most Unprofessional, Incompetent Staff Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in Providence to attend a concert at the Providence Performing Arts Center which is located at the end of the street (about one half city block) from the Hotel Providence. The location of the theatre, small shops, and music/bookstores provided for a good weekend of recreation and entertainment without having to get back into the car. The hotel staff were very attentive; the decor warm and inviting yet also subtle in elegance. The wonderful touches: original artwork; extremely comfortable beds and quality linens; generous full length mirror, full iron and ironing board; huge terry cloth bathroom ......and the ringing of church bells on Sunday morning. Plus the package "deals" included coupons good for meals (up to a &75 value) at the Aspire Restaurant (attached to the Hotel P.) .....Arriving an hour early was not a problem -- staff were ready and welcoming! Check out time was in the early afternoon.... Very nice!
reviews.title: Delighted

reviews.text: Had a great stay at this comfortable hotel and staff was very nice. Really found Providence to be charming and frankly, this surprised me. Plenty of great restaurants in town. Plan an extra day in the area if you're traveling on business and have the time.
reviews.title: Nice service, location, great town

reviews.text: I am very satisfied with staying at The Hotel Providence. They have excellent service.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I had a great stay in this hotel, although, due to paddys day falling while i was there I was not the quitest stay. The staff were wonderful and the food was lovely.
reviews.title: great stay, although

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just check if there is anything like that going on in town before you book
reviews.title: My favorite place in Providence

reviews.text: Wow. Was expecting a boutique hotel experience. Instead got a soulless converted office building awash in polyester. Constant serenade from neighboring church bells; garbage truck docked into the building at 6am -- the whole room shook and the noise was quite the wake up call. Stained carpets, shabby soft furnishings. Disfunctional lobby decor. Plus side: the staff is friendly. Go to the Westin. Yes, it's a chain, but it's clean, the bed's are comfortable, and it's relatively quiet.
reviews.title: Poor value, noisy, grimey.

reviews.text: The staff are very attentive and helpful. When I arrived at noon I was worried that a room may not be ready. Not only was it ready, they upgraded me to a suite. Everything was great in the room including the view, ammenities, service, and location iwithin the hotel. The bar is great, and offeres early evening drink and appetizer specials; not very ofter you can get a perfectly made $5 martini! The hotel is in a great location, and frankly, I thought the periodic church bell were cool! The rate was less than the chain hotels in the area, so if you are coming to Providence, you must stay here!
reviews.title: This is a GREAT hotel wih exceptional rooms and service

reviews.text: Nice Hotel, Attractive room, great bed and linens, nice bath, I went to bed around 9:30...Then the party started! Between the clubs and the street traffic complete with shouting and yelling, horns and police sirens it woke me at 11. Turned the TV up a little and closed the drapes. That worked till the bars closed at 2 AM. A complete repeat of the noise but a double the volume! It lasted until 3 AM. At 4:15 all the folks staying at the hotel Continued the parties with nonstop room hopping and door slamming. for the next 45 minutes. I just got up, took a shower and left. I could've called the manager, but it was a situation from which there was no escape. One positive point, all the noise from the party atmosphere almost completely drowned out the church bell in the steeple 100' away and precisely level with the 5th floor. I had been concerned about that bell earlier in the evening
reviews.title: Noisy Noisy Noisy!! Don't Plan on Sleeping Here --- a least on a Friday night!

reviews.text: One of the
reviews.title: Great Deal for the Price!

reviews.text: Just stayed one night recently at Hotel Providence and loved it. The rooms were very clean, the staff was very helpful. The location would be perfect, except for the obnoxiously loud bells from the church next door. I read other reviews and figured they were exaggerating....they were not. The bells woke us up bright and early in the morning and not only did they ring what seemed like every 15-20 minutes...they played a FULL song at around 8am..a FULL one! Also, my only other complaint is that the walls are REALLY paper thin....we heard the guy in the room next to us playing loud adult movies and having "visitors" all night long...it was funny at first, but after HOURS of the noise, it got kinda weird.
reviews.title: Amazing european experience in the heart of Providence, RI

reviews.text: I have been travelling to Providence frequently over the past year and I always get a warm welcome when checking in at The Hotel Providence. I first stayed here because of its location (a short walk from all the fun things in Providence) but have returned several times because of the clean rooms and friendly staff. The rooms are a little on the smaller side but they have a certain charm that is missing from one of your standard, run of the mill franchise hotel rooms. Looking forward to my next trip to Providence.....
reviews.title: Always feel welcome

reviews.text: I stayed this past Christmas, which was my second stay here. Tthe first time was when I was in town for my high school 25th reunion. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and their staff. The first time we stayed we were totaly impressed with the room, the staff and the property. The rooms are spacescious, clean and very compfortable and the bed and pillows are some of the best I have ever had and I travel a lot for business and pleasure and stayed at many five star hotels. The staff makes you feel so welcomed, and treat you like a VIP, but not overly eager to impress you, it is genuine warmness and caring as it seems they all realy want your stay to be perfect.....which they achieve. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Search No Further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, if you like incredibly loud church bells going off at 7:00 am and continuing every 15 minutes all day until 8PM, then this is the hotel for you! Seriously, the Grace Eposcopal Church is directly accross the street, and they have the Hunchback of Notre Dame bells in their tower. It is ridiculous how loud they are. It was impossible to sleep late, relax during the day, or even watch TV. If you are looking for peace and quiet, this aint your place. Also, it was Valentine's weekend, and we were told after checking in that there would be no room service all weekend, only the prefix $95 Valentine menu, or the prefix theater menu. No mention of this BEFORE we checked in. Then, first morning we realized we forgot toothpaste, so called house keeping to get a small tube, and they said they didn't have any. How does a hotel not have toothpaste?? And the final straw came when we arrived home one afternoon to find that housekeeping left our room door open. Sorry Hotel Prov, I normally only boast about where we stay, but you guys left me no choice. Our experience in your hotel was flat out bad.
reviews.title: If you want to relax and sleep, DON'T STAY HERE!

reviews.text: We had a block of rooms (20+) for family and friends for our son's wedding which was held locally. As well, the Aspire Restaurant hosted our rehearsal dinner for 32 in their wine room. The food, atmosphere and service were perfect and everyone raved about their accomodations and service. Can't wait to visit again.
reviews.title: We couldn't have been happier; felt as though we made a perfect choice for our friends and family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a few positives about this hotel but the negatives far outweigh the positives..The hotel was exceptionally clean,room was amazing,and staff was great...Therefore since our overnight stay was an engagement gift for a night away we thought we were in for a treat but boy were we wrong..my fiancee and i had taken the next day off and planned a night out and to sleep in..well we found out that the walls are PAPER thin.The couple in the room next door to ours literally had our bed shaking,and god forbid i had brought my children w us they would be scarred for life..then when we finally got to sleep the church bell right outside our window woke us up at 7am and continued to go off every 15min from then on. Our gift certificate also included breakfast which luckily we werent able to sleep in because breakfast ends at 10am. So had we not woken up we would have lost out..just not a place for a leisure night or a morning of sleeping in and relaxing.
reviews.title: Wont be going here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Great location, beautiful lobby, beautiful room
reviews.title: Excellent rate and beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: $24 for parking per night, room on smaller side
reviews.title: What a find!

likes.disliked: — A bit of outside noise after 2am when the bars close.

reviews.text: We wanted something with a central location and this was it! The hotel is located in "Down City" yet conveniently close to Federal Hill, Providence Place mall, etc. They were also running a special "Home for the Holidays" rate that was $99/night- super deal for a beautiful boutique hotel. An old building (1897) that was totally renovated with many modern conveniences. Super comfortable beds! The staff was first-rate and offered pleasant service and many fine recommendations throughout our stay.
reviews.title: very good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel to be a jewel nestled in a somewhat unsavory area. The decor of the hotel, its antiques and ambience, were very nice. The staff was extremely helpful and responsive to our requests/needs. The accomodations were very comfortable, nice, and spacious. We got a very good price on the room.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

likes.liked: — The entire staff is first class!
likes.disliked: — Cannot sleep due to banging pipes!

reviews.text: The Hotel's Aspire Restaraunt had great food and great service. The chef's pan-seared chicken was outstanding.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE, FRUSTRATING EXPERIENCE

description: Hotel Providence is nestled in the heart of downtown Providence's Arts and Theatre district. Located mere blocks from boutique shopping, galleries and perfect little cafes/restaurants, Hotel Providence is itself a place where the arts are celebrated and where finding new passions (or reviving sleeping ones) are celebrated! We all have a passion...discover yours at Hotel Providence!
